page.title: 07Transport from & to Nailsea
page.content: There is a regular{bus service}which comes from Bristol, makes a circuit of the town via Link Road,Hannah More Road,Whitesfield Road and Link Road again, returning to Bristol via the village of Wraxall. Two other, less frequent{bus services pass through Nailsea on their way to Weston-super-mare (via Backwell) and Clevedon (via Tickenham). The{British Railway Station,}situated on its elevated embankment halfway between Nailsea and Backwell, is on the line from London(Paddington), Reading, Swindon and Bristol to Yatton, Taunton, Exeter, Plymouth and Penzance. {Bristol Airport}is 6 miles( 9.6km ) away to the S.E. via Brockley Combe. The{M5 motorway}is 5 miles( 8km ) to the West via Clevedon. Thus we are well-served for transport.
